DataElement.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Questionnaire Most Important Issues Past 7 Days Use Shoulder 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of their ability to use their shoulder in the past seven days, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Questionnaire Most Important Issues Past 7 Days Use Shoulder
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients._A question about a person's most important health issues._The most recent week, including today._To put into action or service._The region of the body between the neck and the upper arm.

ObjectClass.preferredName: University of Washington Quality of Life Scale, Version 4
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients.

Concepts.longName: University of Washington Quality of Life Scale, Version 4
Concepts.definition: A questionnaire designed to assess health-related quality of life in head and neck cancer patients.

Property.preferredName: Most Important Issue Past Week Use Shoulder
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about a person's most important health issues.:The most recent week, including today.:To put into action or service.:The region of the body between the neck and the upper arm.

Concepts.definition: A question about a person's most important health issues.
The most recent week. May include the present day.
To put into action or service.
The region of the body between the neck and the upper arm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: UWQoLv4:University of Washington Quality of Life Scale, Rogers S.N., and Lowe D., Version 4, 1999
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NRG study in Rave per request by V.Patel. mc 5/16/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard of four responses from no problem with shoulder to cannot work due to shoulder problems.

PermissibleValues.value: I cannot work due to problems with my shoulder.
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cannot Work Due to Problems with Shoulder

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cannot Work Due to Problems with Shoulder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual cannot work due to shoulder problems.

Concepts.longName: Cannot Work Due to Problems with Shoulder
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual cannot work due to shoulder problems.

PermissibleValues.value: Pain or weakness in my shoulder has caused me to change my work.
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Pain or Weakness in Shoulder has Caused Work Change

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pain or Weakness in Shoulder has Caused Work Change
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had shoulder pain or weakness that has caused a work change.

Concepts.longName: Pain or Weakness in Shoulder has Caused Work Change
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had shoulder pain or weakness that has caused a work change.

PermissibleValues.value: My shoulder is stiff but it has not affected my activity or strength.
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Shoulder is Stiff But has Not Affected Activity or Strength

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Shoulder is Stiff But has Not Affected Activity or Strength
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has shoulder stiffness, but this has not affected their activity or strength.

Concepts.longName: Shoulder is Stiff But has Not Affected Activity or Strength
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has shoulder stiffness, but this has not affected their activity or strength.

PermissibleValues.value: I have no problem with my shoulder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has no problem with their shoulder.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has no problem with their shoulder.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
